alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 5:27PM CDT until March 31 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR BUCHANAN...BENTON...WESTERN DELAWARE...NORTHWESTERN LINN AND NORTH CENTRAL IOWA COUNTIES... At 527 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fairbank to Watkins, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Cedar Rapids, Independence, Vinton, Manchester, Marion, Hiawatha, Robins, Jesup, Center Point, Atkins, Urbana, Central City, Fairbank, Palo, Shellsburg, Newhall, Edgewood, Winthrop, Hazleton and Walker. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northeastern and east central Iowa. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
